item.title: Completing the Square for a Multivariate Normal
item.description: Consider the mixed effects model \[ Y | \gamma \sim N(X\beta + Z\gamma, \sigma^2 I_n) \] where \[ \gamma \sim N(0_q, \Sigma) \] The posterior distribution of the random effect \(\gamma | Y\) is multivariate normal. This means that the two quadratic forms in \(f(Y|\gamma)f(\gamma)\) have to be combined into one. This is a difficult algebra problem which involves an analogue for completing the square for matrices. The best resource I found for the multivariate case of completing the square is this article
